introduction: The following text is adapted from The Call of the Wild by Jack London (1903). Buck, the protagonist, reflects on his experiences in the wilderness.
text: Buck had been in the wild for weeks, and each day he grew stronger and more attuned to the rhythms of nature. <u>The struggle for survival was no longer something he feared—it had become a part of him, a force that pushed him to his limits and forced him to grow.</u> He had learned that the wild was not just a place; it was a way of life, and he had to embrace it completely if he was to thrive.
question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined portion in the text as a whole?
A: It illustrates how Buck’s mindset has shifted from fear to acceptance of his new life.
B: It shows that Buck is starting to view survival as an unnecessary burden.
C: It highlights Buck’s increasing frustration with the challenges of the wilderness.
D: It reflects Buck’s growing desire to escape from the wild and return to civilization.
explanation: Choice A is the best answer because the underlined portion demonstrates how Buck’s perspective has shifted—survival is no longer something he fears but something he has come to accept and even embrace as part of his existence in the wild.Choice B is incorrect because the passage does not suggest that Buck views survival as unnecessary but rather that he has come to see it as an integral part of his life.Choice C is incorrect.
